State funds arrive more than expected

Advertisement

As everyone returns from break with new clothes DVDs and other gifts from the holiday season Penn State received a present worth . million PERIOD

That was the amount of funding given to Penn State for the  school year from the state PERIOD Gov PERIOD Ed Rendell finally signed the budget on Dec PERIOD  nearly six months after the start of the fiscal year PERIOD

While the appropriations are late Penn State spokesman Tysen Kendig said the university received . million more than expected as the state legislature restored the cooperative extension grant that was originally left out of the state budget this year PERIOD

Kendig said this is an agricultural outreach program that allows for community service throughout Pennsylvania PERIOD

However the appropriations were . million less than last years initial funding level PERIOD

This continues the declining contributions from the state to the university over the past few years PERIOD

Rendell spokesman Michael Lukens said there are similar trends across the state and the lack of funding isnt limited to higher education PERIOD

 he said PERIOD 

Even though legislatures are just done with the  budget they are now working on the  budget as scheduled PERIOD

Kendig said the university is asking that appropriations for the  school year be restored to the  level of about . million PERIOD

 Kendig said PERIOD 

Kendig said receiving this amount is necessary to stopping large increases in tuition PERIOD

 he said PERIOD

Mike DiRaimo director of state relations at Penn State said the university has to be patient until the government presents its proposed budget on Feb PERIOD  PERIOD

After this it will host a series of budget hearings from Penn State as well as other agencies that are requesting money PERIOD

When the hearings have been completed it is the job of the general assembly to reconcile the requests with the government proposals he said PERIOD

DiRaimo and Lukens said the budget should be passed by late June and they dont expect the same delays which occurred this past semester PERIOD

 DiRaimo said PERIOD

Kendig said Penn State President Graham Spanier will attend a state Senate hearing on Feb PERIOD  but a hearing in front of the state House has yet to be scheduled PERIOD
